snippet: The Obama administration said that people would be able to compare their options beginning Monday and that the site was now easier to use.
abstract: Obama administration announces that consumers can shop for health insurance and compare their options on HealthCare.gov five days before open enrollment period formally begins; Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services official says new website has more information and is easier to use than one that frustrated consumers in fall of 2013.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration said that people would be able to compare their options beginning Monday and that the site was now easier to use.

headline.main: New HealthCare.gov Opens Early to Allow for Review of Plans
headline.print_headline: New HealthCare.gov Opens Early to Allow for Review of Plans

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
